name: Viva Palmanova

reviews.text: This is the best apartments I have ever stayed in, from the reception to the rooms, to the poolside, they are all immaculately clean. There are five pools, the relaxing adults pool great for couples and the three children's pools, one with slides in and the other a small shallow pool covered with a canopy ideal with toddlers. There was no shortage of sun beds by the pool. The staff were friendly and helpful. Although we were self catering we did eat at the poolside bar a few lunchtimes and they food was tasty and fairly priced. The drinks were also fairly priced. There was entertainment on everyday for the kids. The apartments were clean and nicely furnished with plenty of space for a family of four. Close to the beach and easy walk of about 5 mins to the shops, bars and restaurants. Would certainly go back and wouldn't hesitate in recommending this complex to friends and family.
reviews.title: Excellent Holiday!

reviews.text: The hotel was very clean and all the staff worked so hard. The room was ok but could of done with some tlc and touching up but again cleaned well. The food was just good with great service, i really can not praise it as provided nothing more than a decent meals. What the hotel need to realise is that when booking a number 1 hotel not everyone wants children to eat chips for the whole of the holiday. A top hotel could offer a later meal for people wanting to stay late at the beach or explore the area during the day The area is so beautiful with this hotel placed to avoid the Blackpool in the sun reputation of Palma nova. We did get to take full advantage of the hotel when our sons attended the kids club. I am usually not so happy at letting them out of sight but they was so good with them and they had such a good time.

On a plus side we did enjoy good quality drinks in with the package. The evening entertainment was ok when the group shows came in, but yet again they had the most fantastic artists with some of the best singers i have seen in a long while at any hotels but they had been given cheesy out of date things to perform with the exception of a fantastic young male trio.
reviews.title: Perfect to families with children

reviews.text: I can not say i did not enjoy my stay because i did, but think this was more down to the staff and the area not the hotels idea of what i wanted from a rather expensive week. It is a good family hotel but when you pay top money you do expect a bit more than just good.
reviews.title: Great place, we will go back- but..

reviews.text: Hotel is just 3min to the beach and 8 min on foot to the bigger supermarket. There is a small supermarket near hotel entrance, but there is very very expensive. Room was very clean and maid was comming 5 times a week. A few disadvantages: small ants in the balkon and the living room, lack of kitchen items, too small garbage bin, just one tv channel in english (the other ones were in german or swedish). You can use extra towels to the beach, just pay 10€ for one as depositum. The toaster and the kettle didn't work. We said to the recepcionist and the made came with a new one kettle. Children pool was to cold to our 2 years old daughter. Otherwise there were evening shows to the children at 8 pm every day. There is also a big children playing ground - that was super. We were dissapointed as we should check out 12 :00, but our bus should come just 17:00, We asked if we can stay a little bit longer in the room because of child. The receptionist offered just 2,5 hours longer for 12€!! What should we pay for? We refused and stayed just in the hotels reception and our child was sleeping on the coatch there :/
reviews.title: fantastic family hotel

reviews.text: We arrived two adults and our two kids on a Friday start June, and were well received at the hotel.
reviews.title: Great refuge for the children’s families

reviews.text: We had booked a room with bedroom and living room/kitchen, and the room (1203) was just fine. It is located in the east wing facing the pool area and a balcony facing west. The kitchenette offered the basic cutlery, a pan, two pots a fridge, a water cocker, a toaster, a coffee machine and a microwave oven. Just fine for any small meal.
reviews.title: Amazing hotel that goes above and beyond all expectations!

reviews.text: Initially the TV only had a few channels, but we found out we could access other sat channels. Having two rooms was great for when putting the kids to sleep, and we could sit in the balcony no matter what the weather was like as there was a roof on it.
reviews.title: Lovely holiday, Great place!

reviews.text: We did however miss having internet in the room. This would have made it near perfect for the price. Free Wi-Fi is available in the reception area, and it works ok, but it would have been nice to be have the newt in the room.
reviews.title: Exceptional facilities for all ages, good entertainment with everything you need in one place

reviews.text: The pool area has 5 pools. One very small one for the toddlers. One twitch is about 30 cm deep with slides and a big ship. Great for the kids to play in. One pool is about 80 cm deep and perfect for the larger children who may not be good enough swimmers for deep pools. One pool which is 185 deep. Finally one pool which is only for adults in a closed area.
reviews.title: Fantastic family holiday

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I tried our first relaxation vacation (we normally go on city breaks), and we chose Viva Palmanova. We chose the hotel after seeing that they had an adult pool and sports area, and were located close to the beach on google earth.
reviews.title: Super hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We ended up going to the beach only one time. We had all we wanted in the hotel.
reviews.title: Excellent In Every Way - As Usual

reviews.text: The staff was very nice and welcoming. The first day I was asked if I would like to participate in the daily soccer game or volleyball game!! Why, yes I would! Meanwhile my wife went to water aerobics or spinning.
reviews.title: Fab!

reviews.text: During these sports activities we found many new acquaintances in the other hotel guests.
reviews.title: Absolutely Fabulous :-)))

reviews.text: At night there was a new show for the guests. We saw Abba, Rat Pack, Michael Jackson, magic show ect.
reviews.title: Stunning hotel

reviews.text: Stayed there last summer and we already booked it for the summer of 2012.
reviews.title: This is only my opinion, but it is the correct one!

reviews.text: A great family hotel with water slides and many pools, very entertaining shows in the evening for the whole family. Close to the street walk were you can find a lot of restuarants to decent prices due to the competition. A lot of Nordic people, good or bad...you decide...
reviews.title: "not happy"

reviews.text: The food is decent on the days, the regular "Hamburguesas" and fries, did not try the evening food. Again, a prefect family hotell WITH a "kids free" zone for adults only.
reviews.title: Good family hotel

reviews.text: my husband & i have stayed at this hotel a few times, usually great, even took our grandsons.
reviews.title: Glad we found you

reviews.text: i'v never had any complains about the place & the staff are wonderful. the annoying thing is, we go all inclusive as my husband is coeliac, we find it easier. the dinning room this time closed at 8.30pm we do'nt like to eat this early, but to eat later at the snack bar (burgers etc) we were told we would have to pay!
reviews.title: Great

description: Just 20 kilometres from Palma lies the magnificent tourist resort of Palmanova. And in its centre, just 200 metres from its magnificent beaches, Viva Palmanova Aparthotel can be found. Recently renovated, this establishment is the best choice for families and couples seeking maximum comfort, a full range of amenities and great entertainment for all. Viva Palmanova has three different swimming pools: a general pool with a large sun terrace, a children’s pool with water games and a Pirate Boat, and an exclusive chill-out pool with Balinese sunbeds. Also the Viva Palmanova boasts a complete range of sports and leisure facilities: sports ground, gym, indoor pool, sauna, Jacuzzi, children’s playground, and recreational games, while an abundant and varied cuisine can be enjoyed in any of its restaurants.
